posts.post_content:
Erik's Random card 7/2/2011  
  
Magic 2011 design handed over a cool Leviathan, but it wasn't this one. Theirs was:  
  
Whelmwater Leviathan  
5UUU  
Trample  
Whenever Whelmwater Leviathan attacks, up to three target permanents become Island lands.  
9/9  
  
But we were doing a hole submission, and I heard that someone had a better Leviathan so I asked for hole submissions.  
  
Ryan Dhuse submitted the Leviathan So Big (it raised the sea level); we voted and, after tweaking the numbers, put it in the file. I sent Ryan a note congratulating him on the awesome design.  
  
We played with it. I thought it was pretty awesome. We debated raising it to 9 mana, but in the end left it at 8.  
  
On top of everything else he does, Tom LaPille writes the development column every week. That is really tough. People can be critical in the forums, and people can be critical at work. He takes care to present the accurate facts, but occasionally a mistake slips through. Tom was on both the design and development teams fo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Whenever Whelmwater Leviathan attacks, up to three target permanents become Island lands.

Ryan Dhuse submitted the Leviathan So Big (it raised the sea level); we voted and, after tweaking the numbers, put it in the file. I sent Ryan a note congratulating him on the awesome design.

We played with it. I thought it was pretty awesome. We debated raising it to 9 mana, but in the end left it at 8.

On top of everything else he does, Tom LaPille writes the development column every week. That is really tough. People can be critical in the forums, and people can be critical at work. posts.post_content: I played with this creature this last weekend and I thought it was actually really good especially against green, however, some games it just never came out because of that mana cost. It might be better in blue and green, or some other color that can grab lands. Even in blue if you used armillary sphere, dreamstone hedron, overflowing chalice, or expedition maps, or sanctum plowbeast.

posts.post_content:
I was planning on making a big sea monster deck and then this came out, it's a sign! =D  
  
Time to get 3 more Quests for Ula's Temple :P  
  
A massive fire magnet, but beautiful when you have a couple of negates handy to keep it alive, not to mention the new Redirect.  
  
Oh yeah, and when combined with Air Servant, you can create almost complete lockdown.

posts.post_content: this is perhaps the most underratted card in the whole game...i run a prismatic deck and with the green accelerating my mana production(plus a few gilded lotus) i can get him out relitivly easily(i know that may not be the case with others) and he elicits multiple groans and curses (plus a threat to eat the card...?) when i play him and he basically stops MOST green creatures in the game...so yes i love this card

Posted By: bassok (4/13/2011 3:42:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm not going to jump into oncoming traffic here, but I gotta say:  
  
"lock down card"? I may be missing something but the fact it says "Each land is an island, *in addition to its other types*" doesn't scream lock to me.  
  
However, if you mean "creatures without islandwalk/flying yadda yadda" and it creates a moat effects, a mini lock, I guess I get that.  
  
Heck, this card is boss. I rate it a five, its a good card for any heavy blue deck. If you have heavy blue, you should really consider running this fella.  
  
Just saying, I don't see "Lock Down" here
posts.html:

Just saying, I don't see "Lock Down" here
